newsitem.title: UK: ICO head sees coffee supply/use ratio flat in 1997.
newsitem.headline: ICO head sees coffee supply/use ratio flat in 1997.

text.p: The head of the International Coffee Organization (ICO) said calendar 1997 coffee supply to consumption ratio will remain at 1995 and 1996 level of 1.4.
Celsius Lodder, the ICO executive director, said at the Spanish coffee congress in Valencia that supply was about 1.8 times that of consumption in 1991. The text of his speech was released in London.
Supply is defined as consumer and producer stocks and total production.
"Stocks, whoever holds them, are now a smaller part of supply and thus, the market may rely more on current production," he said.
Lodder also said the roaster buying policy of holding low stocks was also one factor behind the current rally in world prices.

"The recent substantial rise in market prices seems to indicate that the decision to adopt to this (stock) policy may not have been fully considered," he said. ((-- Jalil Hamid, London newsroom +44 171 542 4985))
